concept.title: About notes
concept.shortdesc: Notes are parts of your topic that call out information that needs to be noticed.

section.title: When to use
section.p: Notes can be useful when used only occasionally to call out specific information that you want the reader to notice.
Overuse of notes, such as more than one in a row or more than one in a topic, can have the opposite effect, so be careful to use them only when called for.

section.title: Large notes
section.p: Notes can contain more than one paragraph, list, or combination of those items.

section.title: Note types
section.p:
A variety of notes types are available to indicate why you are calling attention to a particular piece of information. This helps categorize the information for the reader. Your enterprise may not use all the types.
Attention Pay extra attention to this note.
Caution Care is required when proceeding.
Danger Be aware of this before doing anything else. Could result in injury or death.
Fastpath A faster way to do the same thing.
Important Important information that should not be missed. Often, writers decide to either use attention or important, but not both.
Note Information that should be noted but does not fall into any of the other categories.
Notice A potential situation which, if not avoided, may result in an undesirable result or state.
Restriction Something you cannot do.
Remember Do not forget to do this thing.
Tip A helpful hint.
Warning A potentially hazardous situation.
